SUMMARY: NESTED | FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD DETAIL: FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD

gov.nih.nlm.meme.common
Class ComponentMetaData

java.lang.Object
  gov.nih.nlm.meme.common.ComponentMetaData
public class ComponentMetaData
extends Object

NOT USED Represents a releasable software component. The MEMEServiceRequest object has fields for current versions of software components and required upgrades. If the ComponentMetaData represents a current version of a releasable component, the (name, release, and version) fields will have values. If it represents a required upgrade, the (name, server, username, directory, file, and password) fields will have values. In this case, the object will contain all the information necessary for a client application to download the required components and install them.

Author:
MEME Group

Constructor Detail

ComponentMetaData

public ComponentMetaData()
Instantiates an empty ComponentMetaData.

ComponentMetaData

public ComponentMetaData(String name,
                         int release,
                         double version)
Instantiates a ComponentMetaData with the specified name and version information.

Parameters:
name - the name of a releasable software component
release - an int representation of MEME release that this software component belongs to
version - A double representation of version (within the release) of this component

ComponentMetaData

public ComponentMetaData(String name,
                         String server,
                         String username,
                         char[] password,
                         String directory,
                         String file)
Instantiates a ComponentMetaData with the specified information. This constructor is used to represent required software upgrades and provide enough information to a client application to download the necessary component.

Parameters:
name - the name of a releasable software component.
server - the domain name/IP number of an FTP server where the component is located.
username - the FTP username
password - the FTP password as a char[]
directory - the remote directory containing the component
file - the remote filename containing the releasable component
